question.body: What happens to a postsynaptic cell membrane if chloride channels open as a result of neurotransmitter binding?

response.feedback: Correct. Chloride ions will diffuse into the cell and since they are negatively charged it will hyperpolarize the membrane causing an IPSP.
Incorrect. EPSP will occur when positive ions, such as sodium or chloride moves into the cell making it less negative.
Incorrect. Depolarizing is the result of an EPSP when positive ions, such as sodium or chloride moves into the cell making it less negative.

Incorrect. Although the change in charge (more negative on inside of membrane) is the same, repolarization is the phase of returning to resting membrane after a depolarization not the result of a neurotransmitter binding to postsynaptic membrane.

part.hint: Negatively charged chloride ions are more concentrated outside the cell membrane and will follow their concentration gradient to diffuse across an open membrane channel.
